autoop.core.ml.model.regression package

Submodules

autoop.core.ml.model.regression.elastic_net module

class autoop.core.ml.model.regression.elastic_net.ElasticNet[source]

Bases: Model

A wrapper class for sklearn’s Elastic Net.

fit(observations: ndarray, ground_truth: ndarray) → None[source]

Fit the model based on observations and truths.

Parameters:

  • observations – an n x m matrix with n observations over m variables

  • ground_truth – a vector with n responses

Returns:

None

model_computed_fields: ClassVar[Dict[str, ComputedFieldInfo]] = {}

A dictionary of computed field names and their corresponding ComputedFieldInfo objects.

model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

model_fields: ClassVar[Dict[str, FieldInfo]] = {}

Metadata about the fields defined on the model, mapping of field names to [FieldInfo][pydantic.fields.FieldInfo] objects.

This replaces Model.__fields__ from Pydantic V1.

model_post_init(context: Any, /) → None

We need to both initialize private attributes and call the user-defined model_post_init method.

predict(observations: ndarray) → ndarray[source]

Predict responses based on given observations.

Parameters:

  • observations – an n x m matrix with n observations over m variables

  • on (to base the prediction)

Returns:

An array containing n predictions based on the fitted data
